permits.name: Inner Line Permit (ILP) & PAP
permits.note: Indian tourists need ILP. Foreigners need a Protected Area Permit (PAP) obtainable via registered tour operators.

personas.title: First-time Visitor
personas.description: Start with the Tawang Circuit. Ensure you have your ILP approved 48hrs before arrival.

personas.title: Solo Travel
personas.description: Safe, but transport is expensive. Use shared Sumos from Tezpur or Banddewa.

personas.title: Cultural Travel
personas.description: Respect the Donyi-Polo flags outside homes. Visit during Losar or Ziro Festival.

cultural_etiquette.title: Respect Local Privacy
cultural_etiquette.description: Tribal hearths are sacred. Ask before entering kitchen areas.

cultural_etiquette.title: Learn Greetings
cultural_etiquette.description: Say 'Namaste' or local greetings like 'Tashi Delek' (Monpa).

cultural_etiquette.title: Shoe Removal
cultural_etiquette.description: Remove shoes before entering Monasteries and homes.

photography_tips.title: Landscapes
photography_tips.description: Free to capture the stunning Himalayas.

photography_tips.title: Ask First
photography_tips.description: Tribal elders may require consent for portraits.

photography_tips.title: Restricted Areas
photography_tips.description: Strictly NO photos near China border posts (Bum La).

road_condition.label: Road Difficulty
road_condition.note: High altitude passes like Sela can be snowed in. 4x4 recommended.

connectivity.label: Signal Reliability
connectivity.note: BSNL works best in remote border districts like Anjaw.

permits.name: No Entry Permit Required
permits.note: Assam is open to all Indian and Foreign tourists without specific entry permits.

personas.title: First-time Visitor
personas.description: Ideal entry point. Visit Kaziranga and Kamakhya Temple first.

personas.title: Solo Travel
personas.description: Very well connected by bus and rail. Safe and bustling.

personas.title: Cultural Travel
personas.description: Visit during Bihu (April/Jan). Explore Majuli's Satra culture.

cultural_etiquette.title: Respect Heritage
cultural_etiquette.description: Dress modestly in Satras (Vaishnavite monasteries).

cultural_etiquette.title: Learn Greetings
cultural_etiquette.description: A simple 'Nomoskar' is the universal greeting.

cultural_etiquette.title: Shoe Removal
cultural_etiquette.description: Strictly remove shoes before entering Prayer Halls (Namghar).

photography_tips.title: Landscapes
photography_tips.description: Tea gardens and River Brahmaputra are open for shoots.

photography_tips.title: Ask First
photography_tips.description: Ask before photographing women weaving.

photography_tips.title: Restricted Areas
photography_tips.description: No drones over Kaziranga (Anti-poaching zone).

road_condition.label: Road Difficulty
road_condition.note: Mostly flat plains. Traffic can be heavy in Guwahati.

permits.name: Inner Line Permit (ILP)
permits.note: Mandatory for all non-Manipuri Indians. Foreigners register at immigration.

personas.title: First-time Visitor
personas.description: Base yourself in Imphal. Visit Loktak Lake as a day trip.

personas.title: Solo Travel
personas.description: Women-run markets (Ima Keithel) are very safe and welcoming.

personas.title: Cultural Travel
personas.description: Witness the Raas Leela or Sankirtana performances.

cultural_etiquette.title: Respect Elders
cultural_etiquette.description: Elders are highly respected. Use 'Ema' (Mother) for older women.

cultural_etiquette.title: Learn Greetings
cultural_etiquette.description: Say 'Khurumjari' (Hello/Respect).

cultural_etiquette.title: Shoe Removal
cultural_etiquette.description: Remove shoes before entering Govindajee Temple.

photography_tips.title: Landscapes
photography_tips.description: Loktak Lake is a photographer's paradise.

photography_tips.title: Ask First
photography_tips.description: Ask before photographing specific rituals.

photography_tips.title: Restricted Areas
photography_tips.description: High security zones near Moreh border.

road_condition.label: Road Difficulty
road_condition.note: Valley roads are good; Hill district roads can be rough.

connectivity.label: Signal Reliability
connectivity.note: 4G available in Imphal and valley districts.

permits.name: Tourist Registration (E-Invite)
permits.note: No ILP, but registration on the Meghalaya Tourism App is mandatory to generate an E-Invite.

transport_hubs.railway: Guwahati (Assam) is the nearest major railhead

personas.title: First-time Visitor
personas.description: Shillong and Sohra (Cherrapunji) are essential stops.

personas.title: Solo Travel
personas.description: Very safe. Shared taxis (Sumos) connect all major towns.

personas.title: Cultural Travel
personas.description: Explore the matrilineal society and Sacred Groves.

cultural_etiquette.title: Matrilineal Respect
cultural_etiquette.description: Women hold high status in Khasi society. Be respectful.

cultural_etiquette.title: Learn Greetings
cultural_etiquette.description: Say 'Khublei' (Thank you/God Bless).

cultural_etiquette.title: Cleanliness
cultural_etiquette.description: Meghalaya prides itself on cleanliness. Do not litter.

photography_tips.title: Landscapes
photography_tips.description: Waterfalls and Root Bridges are free to shoot.

photography_tips.title: Ask First
photography_tips.description: Ask permission in traditional markets like Iewduh.

photography_tips.title: Restricted Areas
photography_tips.description: Avoid photos inside sacred forests if advised.

road_condition.label: Road Difficulty
road_condition.note: Scenic but winding roads. Fog can reduce visibility to zero.

connectivity.label: Signal Reliability
connectivity.note: 4G widespread, but drops in deep valleys (e.g., Nongriat).

permits.name: Inner Line Permit (ILP)
permits.note: Mandatory for entering via Vairengte or Lengpui Airport.

personas.title: First-time Visitor
personas.description: Aizawl is built on ridges. Prepare for steep walking.

personas.title: Solo Travel
personas.description: Extremely safe. The 'Nghah Lou Dawr' (shops without keepers) show high trust.

personas.title: Cultural Travel
personas.description: Experience 'Tlawmngaihna' - the Mizo code of altruism.

cultural_etiquette.title: Sunday Silence
cultural_etiquette.description: Everything closes on Sunday for church. Plan accordingly.

cultural_etiquette.title: Learn Greetings
cultural_etiquette.description: Say 'Chibai' (Hello).

cultural_etiquette.title: Community
cultural_etiquette.description: Do not overtake ceremonial processions on roads.

photography_tips.title: Landscapes
photography_tips.description: Blue Mountain (Phawngpui) is stunning.

photography_tips.title: Ask First
photography_tips.description: Polite to ask before clicking pics of traditional attire.

photography_tips.title: Restricted Areas
photography_tips.description: Border areas near Myanmar.

road_condition.label: Road Difficulty
road_condition.note: Mountainous terrain. Landslides common in monsoon.

connectivity.label: Signal Reliability
connectivity.note: Good in Aizawl, spotty in southern districts.

permits.name: Inner Line Permit (ILP)
permits.note: Strictly enforced. Even Dimapur (railhead) requires ILP for stay.

personas.title: First-time Visitor
personas.description: Visit during Hornbill Festival (Dec) for a cultural crash course.

personas.title: Solo Travel
personas.description: Locals are English-speaking and helpful. Hire local taxis.

personas.title: Cultural Travel
personas.description: Explore the distinct Morung (dormitory) systems of each tribe.

cultural_etiquette.title: Tribal Respect
cultural_etiquette.description: Each tribe has distinct customs. Be open to learning.

cultural_etiquette.title: Learn Greetings
cultural_etiquette.description: Say 'Kulo' (Angami) or 'Nmapu' (Ao).

cultural_etiquette.title: Food Habits
cultural_etiquette.description: Respect local dietary choices (smoked meats/fermented soy).

photography_tips.title: Landscapes
photography_tips.description: Dzukou Valley is a prime spot.

photography_tips.title: Ask First
photography_tips.description: Portraits of elders in traditional shawl require consent.

photography_tips.title: Restricted Areas
photography_tips.description: Military zones are strictly off-limits.

road_condition.label: Road Difficulty
road_condition.note: Roads can be rough ('Naga Massage'). Allow extra travel time.

permits.name: Restricted Area Permit (RAP/PAP)
permits.note: No permit for Gangtok/South/West. Mandatory PAP for North Sikkim (Gurudongmar) and Nathu La.

personas.title: First-time Visitor
personas.description: Stick to East and South Sikkim. Visit Tsomgo Lake.

personas.title: Solo Travel
personas.description: Shared jeeps are the lifeline of Sikkim travel.

personas.title: Cultural Travel
personas.description: Visit Monasteries (Rumtek/Pemayangtse) for Buddhist culture.

cultural_etiquette.title: Sacred Sites
cultural_etiquette.description: Do not smoke or talk loudly in Monasteries.

cultural_etiquette.title: Learn Greetings
cultural_etiquette.description: Say 'Kuzu Zangpo' (Bhutia) or 'Namaste' (Nepali).

cultural_etiquette.title: Environment
cultural_etiquette.description: Sikkim is plastic-free. Do not carry single-use plastic bottles.

photography_tips.title: Landscapes
photography_tips.description: Kanchenjunga views are free to capture.

photography_tips.title: Ask First
photography_tips.description: Monks may not want to be photographed.

photography_tips.title: Restricted Areas
photography_tips.description: Strictly NO photos at Nathu La (China border).

road_condition.label: Road Difficulty
road_condition.note: North Sikkim roads are rugged and prone to landslides.

connectivity.label: Signal Reliability
connectivity.note: Good in Gangtok. No signal in high altitude Gurudongmar.

personas.title: First-time Visitor
personas.description: Explore the royal heritage of Ujjayanta Palace and Neermahal.

personas.title: Solo Travel
personas.description: Agartala is safe and easy to navigate by auto-rickshaw.

personas.title: Cultural Travel
personas.description: Visit Unakoti for ancient rock carvings and tribal history.

cultural_etiquette.title: Royal History
cultural_etiquette.description: Respect the Manikya dynasty heritage sites.

cultural_etiquette.title: Learn Greetings
cultural_etiquette.description: Say 'Khulumkha' (Kokborok greeting).

cultural_etiquette.title: Temple Rules
cultural_etiquette.description: Follow dress codes at Tripura Sundari Temple.

photography_tips.title: Landscapes
photography_tips.description: Palaces and Lakes are photogenic.

photography_tips.title: Ask First
photography_tips.description: Respect privacy in rural tribal hamlets.

photography_tips.title: Restricted Areas
photography_tips.description: Border fences with Bangladesh.

road_condition.label: Road Difficulty
road_condition.note: National Highways are good. Rural roads moderate.

connectivity.label: Signal Reliability
connectivity.note: Reliable network across most tourist sites.
